text.p: Calendar 1996. Bayerische Vereinsbank gave the following breakdown of the contribution of different units to operating profit:
(in millions of marks unless otherwise stated)

NOTE - Full name of the German bank is Bayerische Vereinsbank AG. The bank issued the figures for the first time, so comparative figures were not available. The "other" segment balances out other spending and earnings such as those generated by selling shareholdings.
In a speech to be delivered at a news conference, chairman Albrecht Schmidt said the stability of its profit basis, divided among three main segments, gave the bank a certain immunity.

Bank business accounted for 43 percent of operating profit, mortgage business for 57 percent. Foreign business accounted for 15 percent of profit and domestic business for 85 percent, compared with a 12-88 percent split the previous year.
